meanings.definition: Of or relating to the whole inhabited world.
meanings.sent1: The explorer's oecumenical journey took him to every corner of the globe.
meanings.sent2: The idea of an oecumenical map showing all countries is fascinating.
meanings.sent3: The oecumenical traveler had visited so many places, he joked that he must have circled the Earth twice.
meanings.sent4: Her love for languages made her feel like an oecumenical citizen of the world.
meanings.sent5: The oecumenical nature of the internet allows people from different continents to connect instantly.

meanings.definition: Promoting or relating to unity among different Christian churches.
meanings.sent1: The oecumenical service brought together members of various Christian denominations.
meanings.sent2: The priest's oecumenical efforts aimed to bridge the gap between different churches.
meanings.sent3: The oecumenical choir sang hymns from all Christian traditions, creating a harmonious blend.
meanings.sent4: Her oecumenical spirit inspired others to work towards Christian unity.
meanings.sent5: The oecumenical dialogue between the churches led to a deeper understanding of each other's beliefs.
